sort of well defined you know a little bit of code that you can take and extend
right you're given web hooks so every time anything happens on github we fire web hooks that you can subscribe to
whether that's creating an issue or opening a pull request that could be

github we will fire these web hooks and you can listen to them and then you can

a great start right the problem here is that you need to bring your own
infrastructure right so github will fire you an issue comment but you have to have a server listening whether that's
you know something in your data center something in a cloud maybe if it's a server list if you don't have like you
know super hard core requirements maybe it's a server under a desk right we all
know how well that works out and so the problem is that that you're hosting your own infrastructure and that's fine for
some things but it's not really necessary for everything right because
when you are hosting your own infrastructure that starts getting expensive whether that's an actual cost
like you are paying for a server or a fixed cost like or you know sort more
abstract cost rather that server under the desk that's gonna get kicked over and turned off and all of a sudden your infrastructure fails
and you don't even know why because you have this dependency so we rewound a
little bit and said well maybe we can fix the infrastructure problem and that was sort of the genesis of github
actions the idea is that instead of making you bring your own infra to the party will host it for you we have
servers in our data center we have s RDS that manage them you know and an ops
team that's on call we can take care of that burden for you and so the idea of
github actions is we will still let you listen to the same events to those same
web hooks so every time somebody creates an issue every time somebody opens a pull request whatever will fire these
events but will fire them into one of our own pieces of infrastructure so now
you can define this and respond to it even and you can create this in scripted
but we'll take care of it and that was the idea of github actions the idea is
that you know instead of making you bring your own app we'll we'll host it for you so we launched this a little
